<se_def>*: I guess this is where I'm supposed to say, ‘Welcome to Baccarat, home of the world's biggest casino!’
<se_def>*: ...But the casino's closed right now, and isn't going to reopen any time soon. Oh, well.
<se_low>*: A man named Golding owns and runs the casino. But he ordered it shut down the other day.
<se_low>*: The odd thing is, no one's seen hide nor hair of him since. What's goin' on!?

<se_high>*: The day before the casino shut down,
a burglar broke into Golding's mansion.

<se_high>*: Golding's been holed up ever since.
I wonder if he was hurt during the break-in?

<se_def>*: Ever since the mansion was burgled,
Golding's servants have been acting quite edgy.
<se_def>*: They say there wasn't much damage done and no one was hurt, but then why are the staff so jumpy?
<se_low>*: I saw some of Golding's men head out of town in full battle gear a while ago.

<se_low>*: They left in the dead of night.
And they looked like they were out for blood.
<se_def>*: This strange jester showed up the night before the casino got shut down.

<se_def>*: He was walking around muttering,
‘What a pity, what a pity.’
Really gave me a case of the willies.
<se_def>*: No question about it. The casino shut down the day after Golding's mansion was burgled.
<se_def>*: The burglar may have picked the right house, but he sure picked the wrong man. Golding once took down a bear with his bare hands!
<se_high>*: Of all the rotten luck... I took a holiday to visit the casino, only to find it shut down!

<se_low>*: Golding, the owner of the casino,
has two kids.
<se_low>*: A son named Cash, and a younger daughter named Carrie.

<se_low>*: Ever since the casino was shut down,
they've locked themselves in the mansion
along with their father.
<se_high>*: I've been on my feet for twelve hours straight! My legs are on fire. I wish I could serve customers sitting down. Oh, the agony...

<se_high>*: This is the take-out counter.
We've got plenty of room inside.
Best food in Baccarat.
Go on in and give us a try!
<se_def>*: I have a friend who works as one of the Golding family's bodyguards. He just dropped by to pay me a visit.
<se_def>*: He said he was leaving for some place called the Dark Ruins. But no matter how hard I pressed, he wouldn't tell me why.
<se_def>*: Hm? Where are the Dark Ruins? I don't have a clue! Maybe you should ask around in the pub in the hotel basement?
<se_low>*: This statue is supposed to be of some ancient sage. Golding wanted to knock it down when he built the casino and hotel.
<se_low>*: But all of these workers kept getting injured. Everyone was deathly afraid of the thing.
<se_low>*: That's why it's still standing here, pristine and untouched.
<se_def>*: This is Mr. Golding's mansion.
<se_def>*: I'm afraid Mr. Golding isn't seeing visitors at the moment. Please come again some other time.

<se_low>*: Golding looks like a bear of a man,
but he's actually quite kind-hearted.
<se_low>*: He took in two children who'd been abandoned at the church and raised them as his own.
<se_low>*: There's no love lost between Golding's adopted son and daughter, let me tell you.
<se_low>*: When Golding passes away, mark my words: there's going to be one heck of a battle over the inheritance.
<se_high>*: Cash and Carrie are adopted. They were wards of the church who Golding took in and raised as his own.
<se_high>*: As children they used to get along like peas in a pod, but as they got older, things changed. Now they see each other as rivals.
<se_high>*: Personally, I think it's because they lost their parents once already. So they compete for Golding's attention.
<se_def>*: Dhoulmagus? Where did you hear that name?
<se_def>*: Are you in league with him, scoundrels?

<se_def>*: ...No, I suppose you wouldn't be. Sorry.
It's just that we're all on edge after the break-in at Golding's mansion.
<se_def>*: I'd advise you not to speak the name ‘Dhoulmagus’. You might arouse the suspicion of the townsfolk.

<se_def>*: Hm? Why is the casino closed?
Well, it's because Cash and Carr<endash> Erk!
<se_def>*: I mean, Golding! It's because Golding ordered it! And I'm sure he thought long and hard about it, too.
<se_high>*: Pickham's a filthy place, full of drifters and grifters. You couldn't pay me to go there.
<se_def>*: I always have a few with Golding after work, but he hasn't shown up in the pub for days now!
<se_def>*: Some are saying he got hurt during the robbery the other day. Now I wonder if it's true.
<se_def>*: They say Golding put up quite a fight with the burglar who broke into his mansion the other night.

<se_def>*: It seems he drove the scoundrel off.
But he hasn't come out of his house,
and the casino's been closed ever since.
<se_def>*: Hello there! Let me show you to your seat... What's that? You're looking for someone?
<se_def>*: If that's the case, I'd recommend talking to the bartender in the hotel pub. He knows all sorts of things.
<se_def>*: Dhoulmagus, eh? There's an odd name for you. Why are you after him?
<se_def>*: What!? He's a murderer!? Well, I'll be...

<se_def>*: If you're looking for someone, I'd recommend talking to the bartender in the hotel pub.
He knows all sorts of things.
<se_def>*: Dhoulmagus, eh? There's an odd name for you.

<se_def>*: I'm sorry, <IF_MALE>sir<ELSE_NOT_MALE>miss<ENDIF_MALE>, but you'll have to leave!
A kitchen in full swing is like a battlefield!
You're liable to get hurt!

<se_low>*: Hey, did ya hear the news? We just had
a break-in here in town. I don't know...
What IS the world comin' to?
<se_high>*: Welcome to the Gold Bank! We'll keep your gold coins safe and sound in our impenetrable vault.

<se_high>*: ‘Save with security and confidence!’
That's our motto!
<se_high>*: Did you hear what happened at Golding's mansion?
<se_high>*: They're saying a burglar broke in!
<se_high>*: I suppose when you're a big casino owner like Golding, you're a bit of a target for burglars and thieves.
<se_high>*: It takes real courage to go hand-to-hand with a burglar like that! What a great man to have as a father!
<se_high>*: We're trying to get ready for the evening crowd, and the bartender still hasn't come back!

<se_high>*: He said he had to talk with his friend
who works in the hotel about something.
If you happen to see him,
tell him we could use some help.

<se_low>*: Ever seen a bunny girl show? No?
You don't know what you're missing.
Drop by tonight! Our bunnies are
nocturnal animals. Ha ha ha!
<se_high>*: I hear that the night before the casino got shut down, the owner's mansion was burgled.

<se_high>*: If you ask me, the casino getting shut down has something to do with the robbery.
Call it a hunch.
<se_high>*: Mrrrrrow!

<se_low>*: Golding, the owner of the casino,
has two kids.
<se_low>*: A son named Cash, and a younger daughter named Carrie.

<se_low>*: Ever since the casino was shut down,
they've been holed up in the mansion
along with their father.
<se_high>*: I can understand Golding wanting to stay inside after the burglary, but I can't figure out why Cash and Carrie are staying in too.

<se_high>*: Maybe all three of them were slain in the robbery, and the staff are covering it up?
Like, whoa!
<se_low>*: Zzzzzzz!
<se_high>*: Zznnnork! Zzzznork!
<se_def>*: I'm sorry, but we've finished serving for the day... What? You're looking for someone?
<se_def>*: If that's the case, I'd recommend talking to the bartender in the hotel pub. He knows all sorts of things.
<se_def>*: Dhoulmagus, eh? There's an odd name for you. Why are you after him?
<se_def>*: What!? He's a murderer!? Well, I'll be...

<se_def>*: If you're looking for someone, I'd recommend talking to the bartender in the hotel pub.
He knows all sorts of things.
<se_def>*: Dhoulmagus, eh? There's an odd name for you.
<se_def>*: Golding used to come and watch bunny girl shows all the time.

<se_def>*: But he hasn't shown up in a while.
I wonder if the rumours about him getting hurt in the robbery are true?
<se_high>*: The bartender? Don't even mention him to me! He just up and leaves me here to do all the work myself!
<se_high>*: The bartender said he had to talk to his friend who works in the hotel about something, but he still hasn't come back! Grrr...
<se_def>*: Golding always used to say to us, after he'd had a few:
<se_def>*: ‘So long as I'm alive, I promise the world will stay at peace.’
<se_def>*: I spent all the money I put aside for the casino here in the pub instead.
<se_def>*: Someone tell that moron to get down in front! I can't see the stage!
<se_def>*: I always come here to unwind after a hard day's work! C'mon, Xanthe! Shake that thing!
<se_low>*: Ohhh, those luscious young thighs! Goddess, help me! My life is passing before my eyes...!

<se_high>*: When he said ‘bunny girl show’, I thought
he meant a rabbit-raising seminar for women!
Not this tawdry excuse for entertainment!
<se_low>*: I really want to get even closer to the stage, but I've got a reputation to uphold.

<se_low>*: C'mon up, there's plenty for everyone!
Just look at the size of 'em!
I wanna dive in and swim!
<se_high>Xenia: Hi, I'm Xenia! Hope you're enjoying the show!
<se_high>Xanthe: Just couldn't help yourself, huh? No problem, but remember: don't touch the merchandise! Hee-hee!

<se_high>Xylia: <IF_MALE>Sir!<ELSE_NOT_MALE>Miss!<ENDIF_MALE> Please return to your seat!
You're blocking the other customers' view!
<se_low>*: Whaddya think? I live for the chance to see Xanthe, Xenia, and Xylia together! Just the sight of them warms my old bones!
<se_low>*: I saw some of Golding's men head out of town in full battle gear a while ago.

<se_low>*: They left in the dead of night.
And they looked like they were out for blood.
<se_high>*: Oh, when will I get my big break?
<se_high>*: I tried out to be Simpleton's first-ever bunny girl, but I couldn't time the kicks right and kept falling off the stage!

<se_high>*: You know the restaurant in town?
That's where I work during the day.
Selling carry-out lunches.
That's why I'm wearing this outfit!
<se_high>*: I didn't even bother changing into my bunny suit because I knew they wouldn't let me go on stage tonight, as usual.<page>*: Oh, when will I make my big debut...? (Sob!)

<se_def>*: I'm sorry, but I can't let you through.
This door connects to the casino, and...
What?
<se_def>*: Y-You heard everything the bartender and I were saying before?
<se_def>*: Uh... I don't know what you're talking about. And he'll tell you the same thing.
<se_def>*: Yeah, we were talking, but we were just shooting the breeze. Nothing more.
<se_def>*: Go ahead and ask the bartender if you want, but he'll tell ya the same story.
<se_high>*: Whew! The bartender's finally back! I thought he'd be talking to that friend of his at the hotel forever!
<se_high>*: Like, ten people were looking for him while he was gone. 'Cause he's the person to talk to if you need to know something.
<se_def>Bartender: Hm? You heard everything we were talking about upstairs? WHAT!?
<se_def>Bartender: Look, cut me some slack and don't tell anyone else, okay? If word gets around, I'll be in deep...
<se_def>Bartender: Ahem. Let me propose a deal. You keep your <IF_SOLO>mouth<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>mouths<ENDIF_SOLO> shut, and I promise to tell you what I know. What do you say?

<se_def>Bartender: W-What!!!??? Look, I'm begging you!
At least promise you won't tell anyone!

<se_def>Bartender: W-What!!!??? Look, I'm begging you!
At least promise you won't tell anyone!

<se_def>Bartender: I knew I could count on you.
Let me fill you in on what I know.
<se_def>Bartender: Cash and Carrie sent a posse after the man who killed their father. They want revenge.
<se_def>Bartender: And I hear they headed straight for some island north of Baccarat.

<se_def>Bartender: Word is, there're some ruins on the island.
It'd make a perfect hideout.
<se_def>Bartender: Cash and Carrie sent a posse after the man who killed their father. They want revenge.
<se_def>Bartender: And I hear they headed straight for some island north of Baccarat.

<se_def>Bartender: Word is, there're some ruins on the island.
It'd make a perfect hideout.
<se_def>Bartender: That's all I know. Do me a favour and keep it under your hat, okay?
<se_def>*: I guess this is where I'm supposed to say, ‘Welcome to Baccarat, home of the world's biggest casino!’
<se_def>*: But the casino's closed, and the whole town's up in arms over the murder of the owner, Golding!
<se_low>*: Hard t' believe that Mr. Golding got offed. Guess that explains why the casino's closed right now.
<se_high>*: The reason Golding isn't leaving his house isn't because he's sick. It's because he's dead!
<se_high>*: Golding's family and servants have been hiding it all along. How long did they plan to keep the truth from everyone?
<se_def>*: I heard a posse headed out to avenge Golding's death, but it sounds like they ran into a dead end.

<se_def>*: They say the culprit's hiding behind some kind of magical aura in the Dark Ruins.
He can't be touched while he's inside.
<se_def>*: I saw this strange jester walking around town the night before the casino got shut down.
<se_def>*: I wonder if he was responsible for what happened to Golding?
<se_def>*: Now that the truth's out about the casino owner's death, people can visit the mansion again.
<se_def>*: I heard it's because the owner's kids are interviewing potential bodyguards right now.
<se_high>*: Even if the owner died, I don't see any reason to leave the casino shut down. He had kids, didn't he?
<se_high>*: So they're his heirs! They should open the casino and run it in his place!

<se_low>*: Golding, the guy who got killed,
had two kids.
<se_low>*: A son named Cash, and a younger daughter named Carrie.
<se_low>*: Now that their father's gone, the two of them are locked in this bitter feud over who's going to inherit the casino. It's...messy.

<se_def>*: Welcome to Goldi<endash>
I mean, Cash and Carrie's mansion.
<se_def>*: Are you here about the bodyguard <IF_SOLO>position<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>positions<ENDIF_SOLO>? Go right inside.

<se_high>*: Ah, are you applying for the bodyguard <IF_SOLO>position<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>positions<ENDIF_SOLO> too?<page>*: There's going to be a trial to determine whether the family fortune goes to Cash or Carrie.

<se_high>*: They're interviewing people to protect
each one of them along the way.
I applied, but I didn't get accepted.<page>*: They must be looking for someone pretty fearsome...
<se_def>*: Way, way off yonder to the east of Baccarat, there's this cliff where you can see a waterfall, like.
<se_def>*: Right near that cliff, see, there's this locked and barred door. Always wondered what's behind it, I did...
<se_def>*: Looks like Golding's son and daughter are settlin' the feud between 'em with some kind of dangerous competition.
<se_def>*: Guess that's why they're lookin' for bodyguards, eh?
<se_low>*: I'm telling you, Golding's kids are like oil and vinegar. Put them together and the result is dis-dressing! Huh huh! I shouldn't laugh...

<se_low>*: Oh, you don't know what all this is about?
See those two over there?
They're fighting over their inheritance.
<se_def>*: I guess they weren't able to keep Golding's death a secret after all...
<se_def>*: Now it's all out in the open. Seems some jester by the name of Dhoulmagus killed Golding.

<se_def>*: What? You defeated Dhoulmagus? You!?
Who are you trying to kid?

<se_def>*: Golding was strong enough to strangle a bear with his bare hands, but Dhoulmagus made short work of him!<page>*: How could <IF_SOLO><IF_MALE>a normal guy<ELSE_NOT_MALE>a pretty little thing<ENDIF_MALE><ELSE_NOT_SOLO>simple travellers<ENDIF_SOLO> like you defeat a monster like that?
<se_def>*: Now it's all out in the open. Seems some jester by the name of Dhoulmagus killed Golding.

Who are you trying to kid?

<se_def>*: You know how murderers usually try to hide their identities? Not this Dhoulmagus guy.
<se_def>*: He just waltzed right in and told Golding his name before he killed him. Like he didn't have a care in the world!
<se_def>*: Weird thing was, Dhoulmagus didn't get a scratch, but he grabbed his chest like he was in pain afterwards.

<se_def>*: It hit him so suddenly... I can't explain it.
He seemed so different from the way he'd been when he first stormed in.<page>*: I was scared before, but that was really<...>creepy.
<se_def>*: Right after he takes down the boss, Dhoulmagus grabbed his own chest like he was in pain. Even though he didn't seem to be injured!

<se_def>*: It hit him so suddenly... I can't explain it.
He seemed so different from the way he'd been when he first stormed in.<page>*: I was scared before, but that was really<...>creepy.
<se_high>*: Why, if it isn't the <IF_SOLO>traveller<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>travellers<ENDIF_SOLO> from the Dark Ruins!
<se_high>*: I heard about Golding's death the minute I got back. Were you responsible for spreading the rumours?

<se_high>*: You were!? Well, thanks to you jerks,
now Cash and Carrie are locked in some kind of feud!

<se_high>*: You weren't? Oh, I'm sorry!
Forgive me for doubting you.

<se_high>*: We went all the way into the Dark Ruins,
but we couldn't find Dhoulmagus.
So our mission was a failure.
<se_high>*: And then we get back to find Cash and Carrie at each other's throats over the inheritance! What a headache!

<se_low>*: When I saw Golding's men heading out of town the other night, I had my suspicions.
But now I know.
<se_def>*: That was the posse that Cash and Carrie sent to avenge their father's death.
<se_high>*: I hear that the jester who murdered Golding came from Pickham. What a nest of thieves that town is...

<se_high>*: He isn't from Pickham, you say? But are you quite sure!? No no no, it's common knowledge that ALL criminals are born in Pickham!<page>*: Apart from the criminally stupid, of course. They're born in Simpleton.
<se_def>*: Golding's famous for having taken down a bear with his bare hands. There's no way he was murdered by a normal man.
<se_def>*: Good day! Allow me to show you to your seat.
<se_low>*: Hey, did ya hear the news? Even though their father just died, Cash and Carrie are arguing over their inheritance!

<se_low>*: There's nothing so depressing as watching family members fighting over money.
I don't know... What IS the world comin' to?
<se_high>*: If you're <IF_SOLO>an adventurer<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>adventurers<ENDIF_SOLO>, I take it you already know about the Dragon Graveyard in the desert to the south?
<se_high>*: I thought as much! You look like you've seen your fair share of the world.
<se_high>*: It's this place in the middle of the desert.<page>*: There's a giant skeleton of some ancient dragon, and the mouth sits right on top of the entrance to an underground labyrinth.
<se_high>*: But there's something special about the entrance to the labyrinth. Only members of the Golding family know how to open it.
<se_def>Bartender: There's some kind of trial that members of the Golding family have to pass in order to be recognised as heirs.
<se_def>Bartender: Those who pass the trial get some strange mark on their hands. It's proof of being the head of the family.
<se_def>*: Ah, you must here about <IF_SOLO>the bodyguard position<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>the bodyguard positions<ENDIF_SOLO>. Thank you for coming.
<se_def>*: Our employers are currently seeking body[-]guards to accompany them on a trial. It will deter[-]mine which of them inherits the family fortune.
<se_def>*: Unfortunately, none of the applicants have measured up. You, on the other hand, seem to have just the qualities we're looking for!
<se_def>*: Our employers are currently seeking body[-]guards to accompany them on a trial. It will deter[-]mine which of them inherits the family fortune.
<se_def>*: Unfortunately, none of the applicants have measured up. You, on the other hand, seem to have just the qualities we're looking for!

<se_def>*: Hey, I remember you!
You're the ones who managed to break through the aura in the Dark Ruins!
<se_def>*: Thanks to you, we were finally able to get inside. Unfortunately, the place was empty!
<se_def>*: And there I was, expecting to come face to face with Dhoulmagus. You wouldn't happen to have defeated him, by any chance?
<se_def>*: What!? You did!? That's absolutely incredible! You must really be something else!
<se_def>*: If you haven't defeated him, does that mean Dhoulmagus has run off somewhere else?
<se_def>*: When we couldn't find Dhoulmagus in the Dark Ruins, we came home to report back to Cash and Carrie.
<se_def>*: The moment we get back, it turns out Golding's death is public knowledge.<page>*: And Cash and Carrie are at each other's throats over who gets to run the casino.

<se_def>*: This is about their foster father's death,
not their stupid inheritance!
I can't believe those two.

<se_def>*: Oh! It's you!
The <IF_SOLO>adventurer<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>adventurers<ENDIF_SOLO> from the Dark Ruins!
<se_def>*: Are you applying <IF_SOLO>for the bodyguard position<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>to be bodyguards<ENDIF_SOLO>, too?
<se_def>*: That's great! With your skills, I'm sure you'll get your pick of working for Cash or Carrie!
<se_high>*: I spilt the beans about Golding being dead to one of my friends, and now the whole town's up in arms!
<se_def>Cash: I take it you're here about the bodyguard <IF_SOLO>position<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>positions<ENDIF_SOLO>?
<se_def>Cash: Glad to hear it! Park <IF_SOLO>yourself<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>yourselves<ENDIF_SOLO> on the sofa and I'll fill you in on the situation.
<se_def>Cash: Yeah? Too bad. But you look perfect for the job. C'mon, will you help me out here?

<se_def>Cash: So you want to be my <IF_SOLO>bodyguard<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>bodyguards<ENDIF_SOLO>?
You've got taste. You're one hundred percent
sure about this?
<se_def>Cash: Glad to hear it! We head for the Dragon Graveyard at dawn tomorrow.
<se_def>Cash: I'd like you to stay here tonight, as my honoured guests. Remember, we leave bright and early tomorrow morning. So don't sleep in!
<se_def>Cash: Look, I understand that this is a big decision, but make your mind up quickly, okay?
<se_high>Carrie: Hey, great! We've been looking for a few good men and women... What? Why? You don't know what I'm talking about?
<se_high>Carrie: Then listen up and hear what me and my brother have to say!
<se_high>Carrie: Take a seat and I'll tell you the scoop. Okay?
<se_high>Carrie: Whaddya mean, ‘No’? I promise, we won't bite. Come on, sit down and listen.
<se_high>Carrie: You'll have a lot more fun with me than my brother, I can tell you that. So pick me.
<se_high>Carrie: So you'll act as my <IF_SOLO>bodyguard<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>bodyguards<ENDIF_SOLO> in the Dragon Graveyard?

<se_high>Carrie: Coolness! Thank you!
We're going to leave at first light tomorrow.
<se_high>Carrie: I don't want you oversleeping, so you're going to crash here at the mansion tonight, okay?

<se_high>Carrie: C'mon, make up your minds, already!
I HATE waiting!
<se_high>*: The casino's been shut down ever since the owner died. But that doesn't have nothin' to do with us customers! Hic!

<se_low>*: Golding, the guy who got killed,
had two kids.
<se_low>*: A son named Cash, and a younger daughter named Carrie.
<se_low>*: Now that their father's gone, the two of them are locked in this bitter feud over who's going to inherit the casino. It's...messy.

<se_high>*: I didn't make the cut, but if you're interested, stop by the mansion during the day.
<se_def>*: This is Cash and Carrie's mansion, but they won't see visitors this late in the evening.
<se_def>*: If you're here about the bodyguard <IF_SOLO>position<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>positions<ENDIF_SOLO>, please come back again during the daytime.

<se_high>*: But now that they're older, it's getting tiring. With their father gone, I was hoping they'd grow up a little.

<se_low>*: When I saw Golding's men heading out of town the other night, I had my suspicions.
But now I know.

his kids wouldn't be fighting like this!
